message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.CC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) - The paper deals with a combinatorial problem of finding an acyclic subgraph in a directed graph, which falls under the scope of discrete mathematics. 
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes an algorithmic solution to the problem, which is a core area of data structures and algorithms. 
3. cs.CG (Computational Geometry) - The problem of finding an acyclic subgraph can be viewed as a geometric problem of finding a directed acyclic subgraph in a directed graph, which can be considered as a computational geometry problem. 
4. cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) - The paper deals with a graph-theoretic problem, which is a core area of game theory. 
5. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper discusses the parameterized complexity of the problem, which falls under the scope of computational complexity.
